text_en: Mental or behavioural symptoms, signs or clinical findings 703 MG43.5 Excessive weight loss • Excessive weight loss refers to a reduction of total body mass, due to loss of fluid, body fat or adipose tissue, or lean (muscle) mass that is sufficient in quantity or rate to create risk to the individual’s health. MG43.6 Excessive weight gain • Excessive weight gain refers to an increase in total body mass, due to increase in fluid, fat or adipose tissue, or lean (muscle) mass that is outside the expected range for normal growth and development, and is sufficient in quantity or rate to create risk to the individual’s health. MG43.8 Decreased appetite • Decreased appetite refers to intermittent or persistent decreased motivation or desire to eat food compared to what is typical for the individual. MG43.9 Increased appetite • Increased appetite refers to intermittent or persistent increased motivation or desire to eat food compared to what is typical for the individual.
